##First let's insert the csv file
```{r}

zoox <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/robertpdunn/kbay_physical/master/data/bleaching_symbionts.csv")
head(zoox)

```

##Now let's open the tidyverse library

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

###and the dplyr library

```{r}
library(dplyr)
```

##Now remove unused columns

```{r}
head(zoox)

zoox_min <- select(zoox, colony, date, reef, C.SH, D.SH, tot.SH, vis, days)
head(zoox_min)
```

##Ok, now I want to create a new column that will transform date from a character to date using as.Date and mutate. 

```{r}
zoox_min %>% mutate(date_floor = as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%y"))
```

#Now that we have a date column in *date* format, we want to consolidate by month. We'll try this with tibbletime

```{r}
library(tibbletime) #install.packages("tibbletime")

```
